title: Need one single letter for an incomplete Logo /alphabet
content:
Hello,

I’m look for a single letter to match a logo. I’m a designer but have never understood the nuances of typography. I’ve also a bit of a passion for cars. My perennial project car is a 99 Porsche Boxster.

I would like to personalize my Porsche Boxster “S” to a Boxster “K”. All Porsches of late (Including mine) have the same distinctive type face for there product name/logo. The type face is incomplete alphabetically. Of all the model names currently available, none have a letter “K”.

All I’m looking for is the letter “K” in the same vein as the Porches script logos. I can provide 5 or 6 of these logos for reference. I’ve really little to pay for this indulgence, but I do 3d graphics’ and 3d modeling and more (krokodesign.com) and could trade time for time…dunno…

Below is the type face as used for my car.

Let me know if you can help, Thanks

PK

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071202192538im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/porsche-boxster_emblem_5044.jpg)

 [‹ B-17 Nose Arts Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20071202192538/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39049 "Go to previous forum topic") [Literature on design of Cyrillic Alphabets, anyone? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071202192538/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39054 "Go to next forum topic")
author: PK2

comments.content:
Not sure how to be more clear…Um…I would like to replace that “S” above with a “K” designed to share traits of the typeface used to spell “Boxster S”. In other word, a “K” which appears to come from the same font family.

A complete font family is not available and probably doesn’t exist

Regards, PK

Hi PK,

I can help. If you send more examples I can draw a “K” (two dimensional) that fits the rest. Feel free to contact me at [martin@martinplus.com](mailto:martin@martinplus.com)

Martin

It’s evident that <cite>car</cite> designers never have understood the nuances of type…

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
